rounds.event: The World Summit Against Cancer for the New Millennium, Charter of Paris is signed by the President of France, Jacques Chirac and the Director General of UNESCO, Koichiro Matsuura, initiating World Cancer Day which is held on February 4 every year.
deaths: Carl Albert, American lawyer and politician, 54th Speaker of the United States House of Representatives

rounds.event: The United Service Organization (USO) is created to entertain American troops.
births: Russell Cooper, Australian politician, 33rd Premier of Queensland
Ron Rangi, New Zealand rugby player
Jiří Raška, Czech skier and coach
John Steel, English musician and songwriter

rounds.event: The Symbionese Liberation Army kidnaps Patty Hearst in Berkeley, California.
deaths: Satyendra Nath Bose, Indian physicist, mathematician, and academic

rounds.event: The 5.9 Afghanistan earthquake shakes the Takhar Province with a maximum Mercalli intensity of VII (Very strong). With 2,323 killed, and 818 injured, damage is considered extreme.
A coup d'état is led by Hugo Chávez against Venezuelan President Carlos Andrés Pérez.
